title: Rp glyph
content: Apologies ignorance. What is the glyph Rp used for?
author: Anthony Barnett

comments.content:
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesian\_rupiah](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311053457/https:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesian_rupiah "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesian\_rupiah")

However, although it is a currency _symbol_, it doesn’t appear to be a _glyph_, at least in Unicode ( [http://unicode.org/charts/PDF/U20A0.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311053457/http:/unicode.org/charts/PDF/U20A0.pdf "http://unicode.org/charts/PDF/U20A0.pdf")). It’s just written using two letters.
Many thanks. It is a glyph in my Centaur MT where it has private use area unicode F6DD

Thanks Joshua for resurfacing such an interesting thread!  
By the way, I think Rp could be made a nice ligature…
